definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
100 ml/one-tenth of a peck/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth of sheng 升 or liter, or one-hundredth dou 斗
to close/to join/to fit/to be equal to/whole/together/round (in battle)/conjunction (astronomy)/1st note of pentatonic scale/old variant of 盒[he2]
Yellow River Cantata (1939) by Xian Xinghai 冼星海[Xian3 Xing1 hai3]

sentences.english: Chu verses, Han rhymes, all the brilliant poems converged into a chorus of praise for central Anhui;
sentences.chinese: 楚风，汉韵，诗书华章汇成礼赞皖中的大合唱。

sentences.english: The chorus of dawn birds is louder.
sentences.chinese: 破晓时分鸟儿们的大合唱就更大声了。

sentences.english: Li's attitude is the first time outside official "rate hike Cantata" response.
sentences.chinese: 李的态度是首次境外官方的“加息大合唱”的回应。

sentences.english: The second program is the sixth grade Big Brothers and Big Sisters performing chorus.
sentences.chinese: 第二个节目是六年级大哥哥大姐姐表演的大合唱。

sentences.english: They were all singing in chorus.
sentences.chinese: 这支歌改编已成大合唱。

definition: sung performance/to sing for an audience
singing voice/fig. original voice of a poet
vocal accompaniment/to accompany a singer/to support of sb/to echo sb/to chime in with sb
to sing opera music (without staging or make up)
to be a dancing partner to sb/to perform as a backup dancer/taxi dancer (hired dancing partner)/escort
